alert.note: Alert for Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 24 at 5:19AM EST until December 25 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero this morning. Wind Chills around 20 to 30 below zero are expected through this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, wind chills as low as 20 below. Winds gusting as high as 50 to 55 mph. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 6 PM EST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Strong winds could cause tree and power line damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Affects from the extreme cold could be made worse due to power outages. Areas of blowing snow may cause reduced visibility, especially along the ridge tops.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
